page.title: 07Farming
page.content: When sheep are lambing it is possible to be up all night getting a single one lambed.When sheep are due they need looked at about three times each night.Then in the morning if the lamb is weak and the ewe has no milk the lamb will need some powdered milk with boiling water and this makes lamb milk.Sometimes you will need colostrum to give the lamb strength.If the ewe continues not to have milk it will have to be bottle fed.This is called a pet lamb.If a lamb is born in a field when it is raining it may need warmed and dried.When the sheep are in the lambing season they are let out of the house at dawn and brought in at dusk.
